solution_line_template: 1 hour has {minutes_per_hour} minutes, therefore {half_hour_fraction} hour has {half_hour_fraction}*{minutes_per_hour} = <<{half_hour_fraction}*{minutes_per_hour}={minutes_in_half_hour}>>{minutes_in_half_hour} minutes
1 minute has {seconds_per_minute} seconds, therefore {minutes_in_half_hour} minutes has {minutes_in_half_hour}*{seconds_per_minute} = <<{total_seconds}={total_seconds}>>{total_seconds} seconds

If Julia's internet speed is {internet_speed_mbps}MBps and each song has a size of {song_size_mb}MB, then it would take {song_size_mb}/{internet_speed_mbps}={time_per_song_seconds} seconds to download one song

If it takes {time_per_song_seconds} seconds to download 1 song, then in {total_seconds} seconds, Julia could download {total_seconds}/({time_per_song_seconds}) = {total_seconds} * {inverse_time_per_song} = {total_songs_downloaded} songs
